body:
The front page shows two sets of data for the sub-repos. One for results
against the current Go tip, and one against the current Go release. The
first set (against tip) should match the top row of the sub-repo page.
That's what it looks like to me.

On 4 August 2015 at 08:32, Robert Griesemer <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Top-level view of subrepos against vs 1.4. Look at x/tools: green but for
> freebsd-386:
>
> [image: screen shot 2015-08-03 at 3 25 37 pm]
> <https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8528975/9049170/0d1b8aa6-39f4-11e5-8b7b-7d03ebcbce1d.png>
>
> x/tools repo:
>
> [image: screen shot 2015-08-03 at 3 25 56 pm]
> <https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8528975/9049198/51d62d5e-39f4-11e5-80f2-9606e265ea3f.png>
>
> First row is not showing, other rows are red.
>
> Yes, the std lib revision hash is different, but why would the top-level
> view now show the top-most row of each sub-repo? Which one does it show?
>
> At the very least it's confusing. I don't know how to judge whether the
> sub-repo is green or not.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/11976#issuecomment-127422188>.
>
